Reviews.Title: Awesome Laptop
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: A lot of people have been giving many laptops bad reviews because of their hatred for windows 8. With the Windows 8.1 update, they have made quite a few improvements, making it a whole lot better of an experience. But as for this laptop in particular, it is fantastic.There aren't many laptops in this price range with such great specs as well as coming from a highly accredited laptop brand. The 8 gigs of ram and intel i7 processor make actions buttery smooth, and startup time extremely fast. The i7 also is a necessity for anybody looking for a laptop with interest in extensive video editing or 3D modeling. I would highly recommend this laptop to anyone looking for a laptop in the $700 price range. The only downfall of this computer is the lack of a touchscreen, but that isn't all that much of a big deal, and for some people not a big deal at all.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Laptop for the Price
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Grabis
Reviews.Content: I like almost everything about this laptop.  It had just about the perfect combination of features I was looking for at a very reasonable price.  Only downsides are the screen resolution (I knew that would not be a premium feature going into the purchase) and the keyboard has a tendency to skip letters if you are not a forceful typist.  My silver lining here is that the machine is retraining me to be a more decisive key tapper.  Fourth gen i7 is fast and handles all my tasks with ease.  Battery life is good, roughly 4.5 hours under normal use.  Trackpad works well with gestures and very responsive overall.  Machine stays cool even under moderate load (multitasking, video playback).  I don't even have anything bad to say about the Windows 8.  I migrated to this machine from an old white Macbook and its been a tremendous upgrade.  I decided to go with Windows since Apple has been consistently disappointing on their recent hardware releases.  Happy with my decision and I recommend this laptop if your usage is going to be moderate graphic work but mainly general office, data analysis use.

Reviews.Title: fast and good value; I7, 8mb, 1tb memory, a lot for the money
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: really fast, once the boatloads of junkware are removed; a touchscreen would be a lot nicer with W8 and for general home/family use, but for Office-based programs, and especially for Dragon dictation, works very well; I'm tempted to go back to W7

Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop to fit my style and needs
Reviews.Author: T. Kim
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a laptop with a full keyboard (including a keypad so I could type accents more easily), a matte screen for easier outdoor use, a large screen, and a fairly decent amount of power for a decent price.For its price, it is fairly thin. It stays fairly cool even if I'm playing Team Fortress 2, which runs very smoothly on the laptop although the laptop lacks a dedicated graphics card. In terms of battery life, on the power-saving settings it lasts for a decent-length flight. The sound quality is pretty clear.I will note that the total memory is listed as a terabyte, which is actually achieved by having two hard disk drives, so there might be some disk-drive switching lag when accessing files on the other disk drive. The ethernet port has a small hinge to expand to fit the actual plug, which might present a possible weak point that could break off later on. Only the top cover and keyboard surface have metal plating; the border of the screen and the bottom are entirely plastic, though this hasn't presented any heating problems yet. The trackpad I'm not a fan of. I avoid using tap-to-click, and the actual clicking mechanism of the trackpad doesn't always work as well as I'd like it to. Initially, some of the keys were also a little unresponsive (I'm looking at you, "u"), but this seems to have gotten better over time. Also, there was a fair amount of ASUS bloatware but nothing hard to remove.Overall, this is a very solid laptop, and for anyone who isn't too keen on technical details but wants a laptop that can handle games, do work, and stay classy, I would definitely recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Daniel Kalski
Reviews.Content: This product is not only built well, but works perfectly. I don't understand why people are giving awful reviews on this product, but it works like a charm. After a few updates for the computer, free update to Windows 8.1, it becomes a nice working machine.The speed of the computer is fast, the graphics are decent, and the multitasking is incredible. This laptop is something for everyone. I had a Toshiba laptop in the past and a HP desktop too, but this is the best computer I had ever. loaded with features at a great price.I hope this review helps all the future buyer, as it is great for the price.

Reviews.Title: awesome laptop
Reviews.Author: Collin Heaps
Reviews.Content: It's a great laptop,  and so far I haven't had any problems. I've used it for gaming and school, and I've loved it for both.

Reviews.Title: Great power in a light package
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: So far the laptop has performed well.  Particularly like the fast boot times, long battery life, and sleek case with a brushed finish.

Reviews.Title: If I could return it  would!
Reviews.Author: T. Bates "World Traveler"
Reviews.Content: This is my second ASUS computer and I was very satisfied with the first one. I have had this one a month and 2 keys have fallen off. Service says that I have to send it in for service and it could take 2-4 weeks. I use this for work and don't expect a one month old computer to have to be out for service. Second issue is he WIFI which continually drops connections. The internet is loaded with complaints on this but their technical support seems clueless in resolving it. I have re-installed drivers, rolled back drivers, tried hard coding a IP address and every other suggestion of the support people and nothing resolved the problem.

Reviews.Title: I love how sleek it feels! Good price, great specs.
Reviews.Author: Rendon Martin
Reviews.Content: This computer is a great price for what you get, it has an Intel core I7 processor and 8 gigs of ram. There is no question that it is fast! It has 1 terabyte of hard disk storage space NOTE: this is achieved with 2 separate HDD in the machine, but it does not seem to be a problem. The keyboard definitely feels pliable and this computer does not get hot (at least for me so far). The only thing that this laptop lacks is a touchscreen and a dedicated graphics card, although I'm pretty sure with the I7 and the 8 gb of ram it will be plenty fast enough to handle light gaming. And as for the touchscreen, I honestly would say Windows 8 is much better with a touchscreen, but that is only if you want to pay $1000 and up.

Reviews.Title: I would buy another Asus
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Eisenmann
Reviews.Content: This is very nice machine, I like the quality better than the leading 2 PC mfrs. Windows 8 is an adjustment, but its great Laptop for the money

Reviews.Title: Loved it!!
Reviews.Author: Niraj
Reviews.Content: Well I'm writing the review from the very Laptop. I received my lappy before the estimated date. And I'm loving every bit of it!! I recommend this laptop to the movie lovers and the gamers because the speed and graphics is super cool. I love it!!

Reviews.Title: I think it is great
Reviews.Author: shanshanclover
Reviews.Content: The speed of delivery is very fast. And the price for this kind of computer is pretty resonable. But I ignore it is not touch-screen.

Reviews.Title: Won't boot up up...
Reviews.Author: david B
Reviews.Content: Bought this laptop and was fairly happy with it until just over a month after I bought it it wouldn't boot up.  I tried all the hard resets and bios boot ups and nothing worked.  At least customer service didn't waste my time, they issued an RMA quickly and now I am waiting to hear back from the repair center.  All laptops can have problems but it seems so cruel to start having problems just after the 30 day return policy expires.

Reviews.Title: NOT TOO BAD
Reviews.Author: R. A. Rolland "RAR"
Reviews.Content: My wife picked this one out (with some help) to be her new computer. We wanted the memory and the large harddrive.Turns out the drive is preformatted into a C: Operation and D: Data drives. I have found in the past that the "D:" drive was set up as a system recovery drive. This one is divided in half and as the operating system kind of mandates all the "document" folders under the user ID you can't move them to the D: data drive. What a waste. I was really unhappy. An online chat with ASUS tech assist said this was done for security measures and assured me my programs would let me store data on the d: drive. Well, duh. But then what is the point of all that series of folders Windows has preordained "MY" stuff anyone.  Other than reformating the drive and reloading Windows 8 which I can't cause they no longer give you a disk(s) we are out of luck. Other than that after a day and a half it is set up with the upgraded Windows 8.1 MS OFFICE, ADOBE products and now I just have to go in and remove all the garbage programs Microsoft put on the computer that are just taking up space AND keep popping up wanting to be bought or used needlessly.R

Reviews.Title: Mediocre screen
Reviews.Author: Jenna James
Reviews.Content: This computer has great specs, which is why I was so surprised that the screen was an average, run-of-the-mill matte screen.  I have matte screens at work, so the real issue was the quality of graphics.  It was not sharp at all.  I had bought this powerful laptop because it could handle video editing.  Who wants to edit a movie on such a mediocre screen?

Reviews.Title: In ASUS we trust!
Reviews.Author: M. Swift
Reviews.Content: I have been building and repairing computers for 20+ years and in the last 10 years have become quite expert with laptops. My opinion prior to becoming very skilled at all types of laptop repair was that they were all very similar. WRONG!!!There are several brands I wouldn't have even if the price was ZERO - because that is how much I could trust them.The key difference, I believe, is the same for laptops as it is desktops. When you're building a custom computer you need to consider many things that will determine the difference between crap and amazing performance. The first, and most critical decision is the motherboard. I use ASUS motherboards in 98% of ever system I build. That means that I've build with ALL the other brands (all most) at one time or another but I choose ASUS first and most often.It only makes sense that if I love ASUS boards I would choose their brand since it stands to reason they are built on that platform too.I LOVE ASUS LAPTOPS!!!Screens, hard drive, optical drives, etc. - they ARE almost identical across the spectrum of manufacturers so go with the company that holds the key to making a difference. ASUS isn't perfect but their products have proven more reliable and better performing than most and to date, they haven't succumb to the nonsense that some other brands have. Namely, the installing of mountains of CRAPWARE on a brand new system. Nothing chaffs my chaps more than getting a BRAND NEW computer LOADED with GARBAGE!!!I've not ordered 7 ASUS laptops for my use (professional and personal) and recommended them to hundreds of others. They have all performed well.These Ultrabook laptops with full 15.6" screens are particularly excellent. Mine had no optical drive with a touch screen (I bought an external drive) and this one has an optical with no touchscreen. They are both excellent.Last word - the sins I've seen when I disassemble to repair are far greater in most every other brand. For the price of ASUS equipment and with the long history of customer service and quality from ASUS - I couldn't imagine buying anything else!

Reviews.Title: Great investment
Reviews.Author: Nadine Collins
Reviews.Content: Great laptop. I was worried about it being too heavy but it is pleasantly light and easily portable. This laptop does everything I need it to do. I've had no issues with the keyboard or track pad like other reviewers. Always, it's so nice having a laptop that doesn't get hot! Great buy <3

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop that fills all my needs
Reviews.Author: Linda Bishop
Reviews.Content: My previous laptop had a 17 inch screen (Dell Vostro with XP then Vista) and I'm going to miss that aspect of the old machine, but the ASUS is plenty fast for my purposes. The 15.6 inch matte finish screen could use a little higher resolution to properly fit some web pages and email displays, but it's a trade off with cost.  I chose the matte over the glossy due to the bright sunlight in the most used location.The keyboard takes a firm stroke to get every letter to "take", but I'll get used to that.Updated to Win8.1 within a few days, and am growing to like it just fine now that I'm not trapped in the "tablet" touch-screen world of the Start screen.The advertised 2 second start is real--nice to get going without the interminable wait of the previous laptop.

Reviews.Title: ASUS X-550La
Reviews.Author: Dennis Wagner
Reviews.Content: I chose this for my wife, as it is a close (X-550C) duplicate to another that was received as a gift. A great machine, storage and speed. Light enough to be moved around, robust processor for desktop work.  I've had it for 6 weeks, and thus far GREAT!

Reviews.Title: very good laptop for the price i paid.
Reviews.Author: Abhner Urtecho
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with the perfomance of this laptop so far. the cooling system is wonderfull and doesn't put heat anywhere near my hands so i can use it for a very long time. The i7 processor is very fast and allows for smooth perfomance. the only drawback is that i don't think you can add a video card to this laptop but then again i paid less than $700 for it.

Reviews.Title: Definitely a good buy
Reviews.Author: stephannye barreto
Reviews.Content: The laptop has met my expectations. All the specs are correct, worth it for the price. If you're a gamer, student, or etc. it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: black screen when use at the beginning and bad charger!!
Reviews.Author: NiubilityDiu
Reviews.Content: This computer performs mostly well. But when it runs, I can hear some sounds inside the computer. I know it is fine, just need time to be accustomed to it.But when I use this computer during the first week, it always have black screen when I maximize and minimize the existing windows, which makes me so confused and disappointed. (But the problem seems to disappear gradually.)But the most significant problem is the charger.1.I think it is not long enough, when I use it in the library, it sometimes cannot reach the socket (- -|||)2.The wire will have the curl up automatically, and leave something like rhizobium in the wire.

Reviews.Title: really disappinted to get a beatiful piece of hardware dead on arrival. i would post a pictue if i could of the frozen screen...
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Computer Dead on arrival.  Blue screen of death...  Going to have to return this which is extremely frustrating.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Very  disappointing
Reviews.Author: John Kral
Reviews.Content: Bluetooth did not work, it took 2hrs to update....very touchy, slightest finger movement caused all kinds of issues, had it less than 8 hrs sending it back.  My 1gen i3 toshiba works better.

Reviews.Title: Hate windows 8
Reviews.Author: K. Juday
Reviews.Content: I have Mac's but purchased this laptop for my grandson.  I was so frustrated with this PC….the mouse pad did not want to track right and I kept haveing to refresh because it would freeze up and that took 25 to 40 minutes to complete!!!! I got this at a good price but so was not worth it, sent it back.  I don't recommend this laptop.

Reviews.Title: ASUS LAPTOPS ARE CRAP
Reviews.Author: computergeek
Reviews.Content: FYI, I am reposting my review of ASUS laptops here because I want to spread the word. This has nothing to do with Windows 8. Both asus computers I have are Windows 7. Having said that, here is my reposted review.i have two ASUS laptops. They are the worse piece of crap I've ever owned. ASUS makes good motherboards as i have one in my desktop computer and it works great. But both ASUS laptops have had many problems. I sent one into ASUS and it took weeks to get it back. The same problem emerged within a short period of time. ASUS refused to replace the computer with a new one. They will only try to fix the garbage you're stuck with. Both computers were rebooting themselves right in the middle of important work. One has slowed down so much, I finally gave up and ordered a HP laptop. That will be my second HP. I don't work for HP and don't make a dime by mentioning them but the hp laptop I currently have has been working great for four years and has been very stable. That's why I just recently ordered another one. So...STAY AWAY FROM ASUS LAPTOPS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Core i7-4500U 1.8 GHz
8 GB DDR3
1024 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen
Windows 8, 5-hour battery life
ProductInfo.Name: ASUS X550LA-DH71 15.6-Inch Laptop (Silver Grey)
